title: The Latest: West Virginia governor encourages vaccination
snippet: CHARLESTON, W.Va. — West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice said the rate of COVID-19 cases in his state is "probably going to continue to get tougher in the weeks ahead." Justice has said he will not consider reinstating an indoor mask mandate and has continued to urge residents to be vaccinated.

title: Sri Lanka's Legal Regime on the Sea
snippet: Part 1As an Island State situated in the centre of the Indian Ocean, the Sea holds out great potential for Sri Lanka. The Law of the Sea is therefore of importance to Sri Lanka as it determines her maritime boundaries and the jurisdictional zones therein.

title: Sri Lanka Tourism attracts over US$ 950 mn investments despite pandemic
snippet: Over the last 15 months (March 2020-June 2021) the government has attracted over US$ 950 million in investments, dedicated to revitalising the island's burgeoning tourism sector, a release from Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority said.

title: sri lankan contingent to the Tokyo 2020 paralympic games
snippet: Sri Lanka's Paralympians captained by the 2016 Rio Paralympics bronze medallist Dinesh Priyantha Herath will leave the island for Tokyo Paralympics on August 20. Herath who won the bronze in the T46 javelin throw is also a World Para Athletics Championship and Para Asian Games medallist.

title: Rs. 100,000 fine for violating Govt's fixed price rule on essential goods: Bandula
snippet: A cabinet decision has been taken to increase the fine from Rs. 2,500 to Rs. 100,000 if an essential commodity is sold at a higher price than the price fixed by the government, Trade Minister Bandula Gunawardane said.

title: Cricketers arrive in Kandy for SLC T20 League : Asalanka, Rajapakse Absent

title: Sri Lanka 'hopeful' to be off UK red list by September
snippet: Sri Lanka is 'hopeful' it will be removed from the UK red list by September. The country's high commissioner to the UK, Saroja Sirisena, hailed Sri Lanka's "phenomenal" healthcare response and said she was hopeful the country was "on track" to make it off the UK's red list from September.

title: Sri Lanka to recognise divorce in foreign countries
snippet: Sri Lanka has decided to recognise divorce in foreign countries and judicial separations in foreign countries. Court decisions obtained by Sri Lankans who have married in Sri Lanka and subsequently moved overseas and filed a divorce case is not accepted in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka abolishes tax on milk powder import
snippet: Sri Lanka's cabinet of ministers has decided to abolish the import tax on milk powder to maintain its current price, co-cabinet spokesman Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said on Tuesday (10). The move comes after severe scarcity for import milk powder has been reported amid speculation of hoarding.

title: Sri Lanka abolishes tax on milk powder import for maintain prices
snippet: Sri Lanka's cabinet has decided to abolish the import tax of 175 rupees per kg of milk powder to maintain its current price as importers have demanded a price hike, co-cabinet spokesman Keheliya Rambukwella said on Tuesday (10).

title: Government to resolve Milk Powder shortage
snippet: The attention of the Cabinet of Ministers focused on the Milk powder shortage that currently prevails in the Market. Accordingly, the Cabinet of Ministers decided to vest the powers to the Finance Minister to study the matter and take necessary action to ensure that sufficient stocks of milk powder are supplied to the local market by revising the existing tax rates or taking other appropriate measures to import milk powder without increasing the price of milk powder in the local market.
